name: Hampton Inn & Suites New Haven - South - West Haven

reviews.text: Clean, comfortable, welcoming hotel just off the interstate. We arrived tired from a long drive down from Quebec, were checked in by a very cheery desk clerk and were thrilled to find a spacious double queen room with everything needed for a comfy night.
reviews.title: Ideal for a stopover

reviews.text: We ate at the Texas Roadhouse on the other side of the carpark as we just could'nt face any more driving, and then I even managed to get some laundry done in the hotel's coin-operated laundry ( only $ 1.50 a wash/dry) before dropping into bed for a lovely night's sleep.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel. Definitely recommend.

reviews.text: Breakfast was fine the next morning, though I was dismayed to see it's still served up in plastic cups and plates. What is it with hotels that ask guests to help them cut hot water and soap usage ( and hotel running costs, of course) by keeping towels for more than one day, and then discard thousands of plastic items every morning?
reviews.title: Excellent service and accommodations

reviews.text: Anyway, this is a very good comfortable hotel and if you don't mind being just off the interstate ( it certainly didn't stop us getting a good sleep) it's an excellent option.
reviews.title: Clean convienient and close to UNH, Yale.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for an interview at the VA hospital which is a short ride away. My double room on the 3rd floor was clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel is very close to I95 but I hardly noticed the noise. The staff was friendly, informative and very helpful in providing local information. I think the hotel is over a year old so everything looked clean and new. I did have a slight problem with the first room I was in and the situation was fixed immediately. The in room refrigerator and microwave were fantastic and the complimentary 24 hr tea, coffee, fruit and hot chocolate was a nice touch. The hotel was clean, and the complimentary breakfast was good and very helpful. There are other options nearby. Free in room WiFi, business center and small fitness center were great too. I stayed here w/o a car and relied on some local taxi services.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had an overnight stay here on a New England tour.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: The hotel is situated close to I95 and other roads, so expect a little noise. Did not bother us much.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable. Great for business.
Predictability is comforting
reviews.text: Usual Hampton quality with large, clean rooms. The hotel is next to a great Texas Roadhouse and there are other restaurants nearby.
Breakfast was really good with several choices.
reviews.title: Ritz-Carlton of Hampton Inns

likes.liked: — It far exceeded my expectations and turned not-so-pleasant circumstances into a nice escape

aka: Hampton Inn And Suites New Haven-South-West Haven
description: Enjoy the coastline of Connecticut during your stay in West Haven. Our property is located 10 minutes from New Haven, the home of Yale University and is close to many area attractions like Bradley Point Park and Yale Peabody Museum. Enjoy free WiFi and a hot free breakfast, as you relax in our clean & fresh Hampton beds.
